header.title: A list of open normativity issues

section.title: A list of open normativity issues
Background
section.p: The immediate background for this list is the meeting of the Sámi language board meeting in Guovdageaidnu, on June, 22th, 2005. The list will be releavant also after this meeting, though. It is a key document to the normativity issued faced by the sámi spellchecker program, and lists open normativity issues. At present it is just an unordered list, future versions will order them according to type and status.

dl.dd: Should the case form of acronyms be written with colon, hyphen or apostroph? Should consonant-final acronyms spell out the epenthetic -a- or not (NRK:s)
Should the program accept short gerunds?
dl.dt: Conditional alternative form livččon vs. livččen
dl.dd: Should unvoiced plosives be accepted in threesyllabic loanwords? What about the other way around? (poasta/boasta, politihkka/bolitihkka)
